speaker: YOUNG MAN
line: It's freezing out there.

speaker: OLDER MAN
line: You weren't gone long.

speaker: OLDER MAN
line: Did you do what I asked?

speaker: YOUNG MAN
line: Yes.

speaker: OLDER MAN
line: It's important, Gary. Promise me you did it.

speaker: YOUNG MAN
line: You're sick, Dad. You should be in a hospital not stuck out here in the middle of nowhere. You don't owe this guy Stites anything.

speaker: OLDER MAN
line: It's not about owing.

speaker: YOUNG MAN
line: I freeze my butt off, checking and re-checking the locks every night. For what?

speaker: OLDER MAN
line: You don't need to know.

speaker: YOUNG MAN
line: Yeah, that's for sure. I'm gonna fix some dinner.

speaker: OLDER MAN
line: Oh, Lord.

speaker: YOUNG MAN
line: Oh, God.

speaker: YOUNG MAN
line: Dad?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can I take your coat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not staying, Agent Doggett. My doctor told me to take my maternity leave. In fact, she insisted on it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's not bad, Agent Scully, you could use some time for yourself.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a medallion commemorating the Apollo 11 space flight. I'd like to give this to you, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thanks.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Because?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder gave it to me a few years back. It symbolizes team-work, partnership. . It means no-one gets there alone. And after this past year and everything that we've been through, it just, I wouldn't be here without you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully. This pregnancy leave - it's just a leave, right? I mean, you are coming back eventually?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're not gone five minutes, Agent Scully, and already I'm starting to feel a stranger in my own off...

speaker: HARRISON
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can I help you?

speaker: HARRISON
line: I'm here to help you, actually. I'm Leyla Harrison. I've been looking forward to meeting you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Uh-uh?

speaker: HARRISON
line: I've got a case here. An X-File, I think. At least the local PD can't explain it. A murder last night in up-state New York. I've booked us on a flight to Buffalo, Niagara. Here's the crime report.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm sorry, Ms. Harrison. Who are you?

speaker: HARRISON
line: Oh, gosh. They didn't tell you? This is so embarrassing. I, uh, I'm your new partner.

speaker: HARRISON
line: I've asked that the body be sent to DC. It was found in the woods about 50 yards beyond the house. Maybe we should begin there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let's begin inside the house.

speaker: HARRISON
line: OK then.

speaker: HARRISON
line: The deceased is Arlen Sacks, aged 72, caretaker for the estate on which this house is situated. There were no signs of physical trauma but local PD suspect homicide due to the dumping of the body. Mr. Sacks was confined to a wheelchair for the last few months and cared for since then by his son Gary, who's their chief suspect.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Why?

speaker: HARRISON
line: Um, because he's missing too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Someone killed this man without leaving a mark. That would suggest premeditation and an attempt to disguise a murder. That doesn't fit with dumping the body in the woods and fleeing the scene, both of which indicate panic, haste.

speaker: HARRISON
line: That's great. What was that last part again about the premeditation? What is that? Slime?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: There's a small streak of it on the floor over there, too.

speaker: HARRISON
line: So it's not someone, it's something? God, this really is an X-File, isn't it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Congratulations.

speaker: HARRISON
line: I gave the slime to the Buffalo PD. I told them we wanted to see the results right away.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How much field experience do you have, Agent Harrison?

speaker: HARRISON
line: Um, actually this is my first time in the field.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let me guess - Deputy Director Kersh handed you this job, filling in for Agent Scully.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Yes, yes he did.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know how to tell you this, Agent Harrison. You're being used. Deputy Director Kersh is no friend of the X-Files.

speaker: HARRISON
line: I don't think you understand something, Agent Doggett. I begged for this assignment.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You begged for it.

speaker: HARRISON
line: I was in accounting. I processed Agents Mulder and Scully's travel expenses.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Then you are qualified.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Maybe I'm not. But I know the X-Files, Agent Doggett. Inside and out. Other people don't even want to admit these questions exist but you face them every day. I am just so excited to be part of this. Aren't you?

speaker: HARRISON
line: Mr. Sacks' body was found here but they found no footsteps leading to it.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Oh my god. There's more of it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Looks like it.

speaker: HARRISON
line: You know what that could be? It could be bile.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Bile?

speaker: HARRISON
line: From a liver-eating mutant. Mulder and Scully chased one into an escalator once. It died but, but, there was just...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This is not a liver-eating mutant, Agent Harrison.

speaker: HARRISON
line: It could be an alien that shed its skin. According to Agent Mulder's case reports they leave behind a mucus-like residue when they, ah, You don't think it's that either. I'll take a sample of this and have it sent to the lab for comparison.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's good thinking, Agent Harrison.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey. Ready to roll?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. I'll just get my keys.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, don't forget this. . Relax the back, breathe in, breathe out .

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know all these things, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm unemployed. I have a lot of time on my hands. Oprah. I watch a lot of Oprah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you for doing this with me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's the matter?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know, I, uh, maybe it's hormones, or, I just, it's just, I'm just feeling so strange about all this.

speaker: MULDER
line: This having-a-baby this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, no, leaving work, I guess. I mean, I, I walked out of that office today feeling like a deserter.

speaker: MULDER
line: You paid your dues there, Scully. More than paid them. You're concerned about Agent Doggett?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, the entire time that I was down there I had someone to watch my back.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm betting that Agent Doggett can take care of himself. He's a big boy. You gotta worry about the little boy. Or little girl. Boy? Or girl?

speaker: HARRISON
line: Whoa!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent HARRISON, what are you doing here?

speaker: HARRISON
line: I followed you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's here.

speaker: HARRISON
line: It? What it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're armed, right?

speaker: HARRISON
line: What do you want to me to do.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I want you to go outside, and I want you to stand by the front door. Whatever it is, I'm gonna to try and flush it out.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Harrison? Take the safety off.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Harrison! Agent Harrison!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Skinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it true?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't reach Agent Doggett and someone told me he's gone missing.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He was investigating a murder. He hasn't reported back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why wasn't I told?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, don't worry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm heading into the Bureau right now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, you're not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, are you ordering me not to go looking for Agent Doggett?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've got every available law enforcement officer out here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You are on maternity leave now. Just trust that we are doing everything that we know to do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know that you are. But what if it's not enough?

speaker: ASSISTANT
line: I'll just take this to the lab.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: It seems like old times. You in scrubs, slicing and dicing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing here, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually, I, I wandered away from my tour. Better question is what are you doing here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I found something that may prove helpful in locating Agent Doggett. This is Arlen Sacks, the murder victim Doggett was investigating. This old man was not murdered, Mulder, he died of heart failure evidently after he was blinded by a chemical substance of some kind. The orbits have residual traces of a slimy substance, known as hydrolytic enzymes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Venom. Produced by reptiles.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you know that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Before Agent Doggett and his partner went missing they sent in samples to be analysed. Hydrolytic enzymes. Skinner told me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I, uh, I also found some bacteria in the venom which I am going to do a culture on.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let somebody else do it. There are other concerns right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know. But this is an X-File, Mulder, and you are out of the Bureau. If now I go home, where is Skinner going to find someone qualified to look into this.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know where he could find somebody...

speaker: HARRISON
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Are you alright?

speaker: HARRISON
line: It's burned my eyes with something. My vision's all blurry.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Makes two of us.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Three, actually.

speaker: HARRISON
line: I think this is Gary Sacks, the son of the murder victim.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How did you get down here?

speaker: HARRISON
line: It dragged me down here. Not sure. So what do we do now.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Mulder and Scully investigated a case once in Florida, that involved subterranean men who took people underground.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No. This is not a man. I fell through some kind of trap. I guess that someone put that there to provide live meals for this thing.

speaker: HARRISON
line: You're not saying that includes us?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't intend to wait around to find out. These tunnels were built by bootleggers back in prohibition. There's got to be one that leads back to the house.

speaker: HARRISON
line: There's something up there, I think, some kind of light.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can't tell how high up that is.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder, you're not supposed to be out here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not out here. What happened to the search?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The police in West Ellicot found Doggett's car parked at a convenience store about half an hour from here.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did it get there?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know, but we are re-directing our searches.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I'll take a walk in the woods.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We've already had 40 people looking around out there, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now, what the hell, I'm out of a job already, right?

speaker: (CUT BACK TO
line: Agent DOGGETT, still climbing up the shaft.)

speaker: (CUT BACK TO
line: Shaft - Agent DOGGETT is still climbing.)

speaker: MAN
line: I thought all you people left.

speaker: MULDER
line: You are?

speaker: MAN
line: Herman Stites. I own this property.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're just the man I want to speak to, Mr. Stites. Have you seen anything unusual around here?

speaker: STITES
line: Unusual? How?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dangerous animals, reptiles.

speaker: STITES
line: I'm confused. I thought the police were looking for a man. Arlen's son, Gary.

speaker: MULDER
line: That is what they are looking for.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm alright.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think Gary Sacks committed the crime, Mr. Stites. I think he is a victim himself.

speaker: STITES
line: I didn't catch your name, Agent.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kersh. Alvin Kersh.

speaker: STITES
line: I am a scientist, Mr. Kersh.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of scientist are you?

speaker: STITES
line: Biologist. So I know something about animals. They don't generally carry men off into the woods like poor Mr. Sacks.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think this was an animal. I think it was a man using some kind of reptile venom to blind them first.

speaker: STITES
line: That would be quite a trick.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, you would really have to know what you were doing. You would have to be, say, a scientist.

speaker: STITES
line: Are you accusing me of something, Mr. Kersh?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I'm just thinking out loud, Mr. Stites.

speaker: (CUT BACK TO
line: Overhead shot of DOGGETT very close to the top of the shaft. He pushes up a metal grating and gets one hand on the ground. He sees feet approaching, a figure - it is STITES.)

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I need a hand.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Agent Doggett. What happened?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I lost my grip, with a little help from the man upstairs.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hey! Hey!! Hey!! I'm a Federal Agent!

speaker: HARRISON
line: I don't understand. Why would he want to keep us down here?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You wanted to face the unknown, Agent Harrison, well you're facing it now.

speaker: HARRISON
line: But who is he?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Some kind of scientist, I think. I saw some books and papers on biology in his library.

speaker: HARRISON
line: It could be some kind of symbiotic relationship between this man and this creature. Mulder and Scully...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder and Scully aren't here, Agent Harrison, we are. And wild speculation isn't going to help us find the way out.

speaker: HARRISON
line: You think I'm pretty foolish, don't you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I appreciate your enthusiasm, but you want to take leaps unsupported by the facts. Now what I want you to do is, stay with that guy right there while I look for another way out. And if this thing comes near you I want you to shoot.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Agent Doggett!

speaker: HARRISON
line: He's gone.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you mean, he's gone?

speaker: HARRISON
line: I don't know. It must have taken him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm spitting sunflower shells on Herman Stites' driveway. What are you doing, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just got off the phone with Skinner who is furious. This man Stites just called him saying you've been impersonating Deputy Director Kersh and making baseless accusations.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what's he mad about? Me impersonating Kersh or me harassing Stites?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the victim had reptile venom in his eyes, are you now saying that it was a man who did this?

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you saying it is, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know this may be hard to believe coming from me but some kind of reptile attack is the only explanation consistent with the scientific evidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think it is a monster we are dealing with here, I think it is a man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now why do you say that?

speaker: MULDER
line: You re-gifted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry?

speaker: MULDER
line: My Apollo medallion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You found it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. I found it on the grass on Stites' estate. Doggett must be around here somewhere.

speaker: ASSISTANT
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I gotta go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What am I looking at?

speaker: ASSISTANT
line: As you asked, we cultured the bacteria from the hydrolytic enzymes that were sprayed in the old man's eyes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like they're breaking down the tissue.

speaker: ASSISTANT
line: That's exactly what they're doing. The venom blinds its victim, then the bacteria excretes protease and collagenase throughout the victim's body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Digestive enzymes.

speaker: ASSISTANT
line: Muscle, bone, all of it is slowly liquefied for easy digestion while the victim's skin is made hard and brittle forming a sac or shell from which the reptile can drink.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So the reptile sprays its victim, then all it has to do is wait.

speaker: ASSISTANT
line: There are precedents for this sort of thing in nature.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but there are no species that can do all of this. At least not yet.

speaker: ASSISTANT
line: What do you mean?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Talk about the blind leading the blind.

speaker: HARRISON
line: I owe you an apology, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're doing fine, Agent Harrison. Hang tough.

speaker: HARRISON
line: You're right. I am not qualified.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We're going to find a way out of here, Agent Harrison.

speaker: HARRISON
line: I don't think I am.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What is it?

speaker: HARRISON
line: Whatever happened to Sacks, I think it's happening to me. I'm completely blind now.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Oh god. Agent Doggett!

speaker: HARRISON
line: I think it's Gary Sacks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were right about Herman Stites, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did you find.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Stites is a crypto-biologist, specialising in reptile genetics. Listen to this. It says here that he published a monograph last year claiming to be on the verge of creating a new species of reptile.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't think he succeeded, do you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. He dropped out of sight and never published a follow-up. But Mulder, the bacteria inside this venom - if Stites is genetically altering reptile breeds it may explain the peculiar properties.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, are you listening to me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think Mr. Stites may have a lot more than that to explain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder! Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Stites! Mr. Stites, open up!

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Stites! Open the door!

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Stites!

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Stites!

speaker: STITES
line: What do you want?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is it, Mr. Stites? This thing you're protecting, this creature of yours. I don't think you meant for it to, but it got out last night and attacked the caretaker and his son and then it attacked my colleague. Now, I can have 50 men in here to comb this place within the hour. Where are they, Mr. Stites?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's alright. It's just me. It don't make any damn sense. There's no exit except that door.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Maybe it does.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right here.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's alright, Agent Doggett. We're gonna get you out of here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who's that with you?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the man who lives here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's been protecting this thing. He's kept us down here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett, I know...

speaker: HARRISON
line: It's him. He's not protecting it, he *is* it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett. I don't have a weapon. I'm coming to get yours.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or, I'm not.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder, I can't see. Mulder, where is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's right above you. It's coming this way.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where, Mulder? I can't see.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get down. Aim at the sound of my voice.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No! I'll shoot you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're not going to shoot me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can't see!

speaker: MULDER
line: Aim at the sound of my voice.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where is it!

speaker: MULDER
line: Aim at me!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No!

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll tell you when to fire. Fire!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder! Agent Mulder!!

speaker: MULDER
line: Right here. Right here, Agent Doggett.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is this it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. No.

speaker: MULDER
line: We just came by to visit Agent Harrison.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is she?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: She's on the same anti-venom treatment I got. Her eyesight's pretty much back, the doctors say she's gonna be fine physically.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Skinner said she won't be returning to the X-Files.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That was her choice. So it's gonna be me for a while.

speaker: MULDER
line: I want to return something to you that I think you deserve to keep.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I appreciate the gesture but if it's all the same to you, there's someone else who should have it.

speaker: HARRISON
line: No way. This means, I can't tell you what this means to me.

speaker: HARRISON
line: Can I ask you something?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sure.

speaker: HARRISON
line: When you went to Antarctica to save Agent Scully from being taken by that spaceship and you ran out of gas in your Sno-cat. How did you get back?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um, well, first of all, it was never actually proven that it was a spaceship...

speaker: MULDER
line: It wasn't?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, no, what happened was that we fell off of something that...

speaker: MULDER
line: Something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... that rose out of the ice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well what do you think that was?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I don't know what it was. But we never got, we didn't actually get to see a spaceship.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't believe that you're saying it's not a spaceship.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it couldn't have been a spaceship.

speaker: MULDER
line: Course it was a spaceship.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we don't know it was a spaceship. But you don't have a picture of it or anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know it was a spaceship. You saw it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, no, no, no, remember, I was unconscious and when I woke up there was no spaceship.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now, come on, Scully. It was a spaceship.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, n-n-n-no.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you were frozen, and I hugged you....
